programme.title: Sign Up - Into Football
programme.desc: Highlights and analysis in a groundbreaking series that uses British Sign Language and subtitles to make our coverage accessible to deaf and hearing audiences alike.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 1
programme.desc: Following a football team in the highlands of Ireland made of members of the same family who speak a language that none of their opponents understand.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 2
programme.desc: A profile of an amateur Romanian football team forced to transplant a football pitch from a nearby village because of pollution created by industrial activity.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 3
programme.desc: With a cemetery behind one of the goals, this is where players of Vilar de Barrio play. The clay pitch is described as the 'worst in Spain' and the coach is running for mayor.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 4
programme.desc: In Ireland, a home captain recounts the previous night's Christmas party, and a tight and terrible game ends with the captain getting told off by his mother.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 5
programme.desc: Witness the remarkable journey of the one-armed goalkeeper who has defied all odds and refuses to give up.

programme.title: The Muddy Roots of Football - Part 6
programme.desc: On the Arctic Circle, a special annual match unfolds, where 86-year-old players from neighboring villages battle it out for one last time.
